page.title: 01LANDSCAPE NORTH OF HOVE
page.content: GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF BLOCK {This twelve square kilometre area is {on the Dip Slope of the South Downs {north of Hove. Part of the deep dry {valley known as the Devil's Dyke is in {square 2610. Most of the land is {farmed, arable or grazing, in rotation {and there are three farm houses.There {are two Golf Clubs, each with a Club {House and there are small areas of {scrubby trees, mostly hawthorn, elder {and gorse. There is a minor road from {Brighton going north but no public {transport.A branch of this road leads {to the Devil's Dyke. The South Downs {Way, long distance footpath traverses {the scarp of the Downs and a number of {ancient tracks, which are rights of {way,cross the area from north to {south.The advent of the tractor which {allows the cultivation of steep slopes {has destroyed the open Downland here.}
